editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msDesc.head: COWTON ON II-IV SENT; S. XIV in.

msItem.author: ROBERT COWTON
msItem.title: Commentary on II-IV Sent.
msItem.incipit: Circa distinctionem primam secundi libri questione primo
msItem.explicit: in futuro experimentaliter discere faciat, Qui ...
msItem.note: unpr.; Stegmüller, Sent. 732; Sharpe, Handlist, pp. 510–11, not this copy. A list of quaestiones to bk. 2 occurs on fols. 124v-5; on 125v is a long passage which is apparently an alternative text for q. 3, in a different hand and with red paraphs. fols. 198–9v blank, presumably intended for a list of the quaestiones in bk. 3. On fol. 236rv is a list of the quaestiones in bk. 4.

supportDesc.extent:
239 leaves (i + 238) 295 185
240 130
The edges retrimmed affecting marginalia and stained yellow.
supportDesc.collation: A4(1, 3 canc.), 1–1012, 114, 12–1712, a bifolium, 18–2012, 216(lacks 2, 3, 6, and the outer half of 4); catchwords and leaf-numbering. The last quire is numbered XXII at the beginning.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 55–60 lines.

handDesc.handNote: A single proficient anglicana hand, using pale ink. Marginal corrections and notes of s. xiv and xv, especially in bk. 3.

decoDesc.decoNote: Blue initials flourished in red; red or blue paraphs. At the foot of fol. 235v is a pencilled calculation apparently of the number of initials.

binding.p: s. xix ex.; bare, chamfered oak boards with projecting squares, backed with vellum; sewn on seven bands. An earlier binding had two straps. Near the foot of fol. 238v is the mark of the large iron chain-staple.

history.provenance: Part 2 of a set with MS 93. Probably made at Oxford, at first owned by Walter Rammesbury. On fol. iv is ‘primum supplementum’, s. xiv. On fol. 1v: an erased single-line inscription at the head: Liber magistri conuentus fratrum ; in a formal hand of s. xv Liber domus scolarium de Merton in Oxon’ ex dono M. Walteri Ramesbury inceptor in theologia precentorque in ecclesia Herfordensis ac quondam prefate domus consocii; in the same hand Scriptum inceptoris Coutone super secundum tertium et 4um sententiarum. For Walter Rammesbury, fellow in 1360, until at least 1381, d. by Nov. 1406, see MS 4.
Below is ‘I. 1. 1 (XCII)’ in red. ‘12’ is inked on the foredge.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.
